intro: Oenothera cedrosensis, commonly known as Cedros Island evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mexican state of Baja California. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom at night. The plant typically grows in coastal dunes and sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with hairy surfaces that help reduce water loss. Oenothera cedrosensis is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar to nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
